fields.summary: License exceeded message when within limits

fields.description:
One of the useful things about jira studio is the project context that you get when working with a particular project.  That is, select a project from the drop down at the top of the page, and then clicking any of the tabs will take you to the appropriate confluence/fisheye/crucible page for that project.

When you are within jira and click on a link that takes you to the issues navigator, you lose that context.  /sadface

To clarify, you lose the context while you are on the issues navigator.
fields.summary: Project context is lost when using issue navigator

fields.description:
"As a product owner, I don't like the way the navigation in Greenhopper changed with the latest release."

It used to be that issues/cards opened in a modal over the board that could be closed after editing and return to my list on the planning / task board.  Now clicking the issue navigates to the page for the issue, instead of loading it as a modal window.  To return to the board, the agile navigation menu item is used, which looses context (e.g. on the fly filters), which then needs to be reconfigured.

A second link next to the issue number that functions as a "open as modal window" would be extremely useful, while keeping the existing functionality of opening issues as a page in place, and increase efficiency of working with agile projects for the whole team. (why was this changed in this release?)
fields.summary: Better issue navigation in Greenhopper board views
jira-fisheye-plugin is broken

fields.description:
Currently Studio overrides JIRA classes to provide multiple email domains suppport. An issue [JRA-24787|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24787] has been filed against JIRA project.

When upgrading to the version of JIRA that contains the fix, we need to remove the overrides and provide an upgrade task if JIRA's implementation is not compatible with Studio's.
fields.summary: Remove overriding classes and provide an upgrade task when JIRA supports multiple email domains natively.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* go to http://test.jira.com/secure/admin/jira/EditLookAndFeel!default.jspa
* change the colour for 'Header Separator Color'
* click 'update'

Note that the Header Separator colour has not changed.

Also it's spelt incorrectly. "Header Separator Color" should be "Header Separator Colour" in order to be consistent with the others.
fields.summary: In the 'Look & Feel' section the 'Header Separator Color' cannot be saved

fields.description:
Tomcat's temp directory (e.g. {{/opt/j2ee/domains/jirastudio.com/instance/jira/tomcat/temp}}) can accumulate a lot of junk over time. I've seen an instance where the root partition filled up due to thousands of {{jfreechart-onetime-8750426128070495084.png}} files in there. While there was only about 600MB worth of these files, they actually use up several gigabytes on disk.

We should clear out this directory when the application is started.
fields.summary: Contents of Tomcat's temp directory can fill up root partition

fields.description:
In the May 2011 release of Studio it included Jira 4.3 which allows customers to configure their own "issues from email" configuration (namely, it now requires 'administrator' access rather than 'system-administrator' access). This happened in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22495

We need to update our documentation to reflect this, e.g.
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=169120574
- http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=169120563
fields.summary: Customers can now configure "issues from email" in JIRA themselves
Tempo is disabled on upgrade for existing customers

fields.description:
This seems only impact IE7. Have tried IE8, FireFox 3.6 and Safari 5 (on Windows) - all look fine.

Some Crucible drop-down menus or links (such as "Tools", "Complete", "Reopen", "Join Review", etc) appear on top of the history drop-down menu. The similar UI elements in other applications don't have this problem.

This doesn't seem to be related to the new header, as it exists with the old header as well.

!crucible-z-index.png!
fields.summary: Crucible UI elements overlap history menu in IE7

fields.description:
By default on a new Studio instance, the "Browse Users" permission is only granted to the "developers" group. This means that administrators and system administrators can't use user pickers, despite being able to browse users through the admin console.

Is there any reason not to grant this to all users by default?
fields.summary: Administrators don't have "Browse Users" permission by default

fields.description:
Confluence still depends on an old version of AGMP because JIRA and Confluence were upgraded separately. It should use the same version as JIRA so it can pick up fixes.

This ticket relates to changes in the AGMP codebase, not the JST codebase. It is filed in JST because we handle all AGPM tickets under the JST project.
fields.summary: Remove the use of legacy gapps version
Start applications in parallel in functional tests

fields.description:
The svn importer creates a backup whenever an import is run. If you attempt to restore that backup, the admin is warned that the "js-jira" user is not known. This is an internal user to Studio and shouldn't be exposed to the customer - there is likely to be confusion, as we are specifically asking them to confirm that this is OK.

!JsJIRA.png!
fields.summary: Svn importer lists "js-jira" as an unknown user when restoring from backup

fields.summary: LazyInitializationException when accessing a code review

fields.description:
The OpenID domain discovery is typically resolved via a couple of HTTP requests, which can be quite expensive. The discovery result is therefore cached (org.openid4java.util.HttpCache) to optimise the number of HTTP requests. The cache seconds-to-live value in openid4java (org.openid4java.util.HttpRequestOptions._cacheTTLSeconds) is defaulted to -1, which means it never expires. This value is never set in either our code or the openid4java library.

This is normally fine, except when JIRA is recently restarted, and for the first time a user tries to login, the connection to the domain or Google is not working. Then the bad result is cached, preventing users from logging in even when the connection is restored. When this happens, it requires support to restart JIRA.

Normally when this happens, the user will see the following error message on login page constantly:
{noformat}
org.openid4java.discovery.DiscoveryException: 0x500: discovery on myGappsDomain.com failed.
{noformat}.
fields.summary: OpenID domain discovery result is cached forever

There's already a com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataImport.reindex() call which is possibly too early since we also want to have our changes indexed. I don't know exactly why we trigger another index or what of our changes is landing on the index, but the "java.lang.IllegalStateException: Indexing is disabled" message is probably wrong since jira.option.indexing is true, so it's more a problem of the custom index path.
fields.summary: Studio JIRA importer fails on import with custom index paths

fields.description:
If an svn import fails, the svn root directory (/data/jirastudio/svn/root) is moved to /data/jirastudio/svn/root.back and root no longer exists. 

All subsequent imports will fail:
{noformat}
Last import result was: Error importing file "repo-with-TST-and-PL-project-and-good-structure.dmp" at 6/6/11 1:51 PM:
 Destination '/data/jirastudio/svn/root' directory cannot be created
{noformat}

A customer admin will not have file system access to the machine to correct this.
fields.summary: Cannot recover from an svn import failure due to missing "root" directory

fields.description:
Navigate to user info of an unactivated Google user, select Edit Groups, try joining a group. The error message is:
"Adding the user to the groups you have selected will grant the 'JIRA Users' permission to the user in JIRA. This will exceed the number of users allowed to use JIRA under your license. Please reduce the number of users with the 'JIRA Users', 'JIRA Administrators' or 'JIRA System Administrators' global permissions or consider upgrading your license."
fields.summary: Incorrect error message recieved when modifying unactivated Google users

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
Request to bundle JIRA Gantt Chart Project plugin into JIRA Studio.

https://plugins.atlassian.com/41404

fields.summary: Error logged when viewing the source issue tab panel

fields.description:
We have some reports from support that after the May release the JIRA logs are growing a lot faster than they used to.
It was not uncommon to have 6 months of logs archived on the same machine, now for some customers we are seeing the logs rotating in a matter a few days.
The possible culprit is the introduction of Embeeded-Crowd with classes that don't have the proper threshold configured.
The side effects of this is that the system start to be really IO bound because of the need of writing the logs to the disk, in a critical load scenario this could bring the instance to have poor performance.
fields.summary: Reduce the verbosity of the Embeeded-Crowd log

fields.description:
The TestConfluencePlugins.testStudioPluginsAreEnabledAndCannotBeDisabled and TestJiraPluginsPage.testStudioPluginsAreEnabledAndCannotBeDisabled tests have both been flaky for a while on the BEAC build. An example of a build where these tests have failed is:
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-AOD-306

The tests fail due to a timeout on a request to the upm rest interface (to retrieve plugin information).
{noformat}
com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Maximum number of retries (2) reached.
	at com.atlassian.sal.core.net.HttpClientRequest.execute(HttpClientRequest.java:269)
	at com.atlassian.studio.functest.core.utils.RestUtils.execute(RestUtils.java:347)

	at com.atlassian.studio.functest.core.UpmClient.getPluginByKey(UpmClient.java:76)
	at com.atlassian.studio.functest.tests.simple.TestConfluencePlugins.testStudioPluginsAreEnabledAndCannotBeDisabled(TestConfluencePlugins.java:72)
Caused by: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
	at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:129)
	at java.io.BufferedInputStream.fill(BufferedInputStream.java:218)

fields.description:
The 'User Type' column in the User Browser is showing the wrong information for Google Apps users.  The 'needs activation' used to go away after the user had properly logged into JIRA Studio however it seems to remain now no matter what.  In some instances, the 'needs activation' is missing on authenticated Google Users but I suspect these users authenticated in a previous version of JIRA Studio.

Also affects the current build on googledev as of June 1st.
fields.summary: JIRA User Type incorrectly shows 'needs activation' for authenticated Google Users

fields.description:
*Original request description:*
 We requested this plugin to be made available under AOD-19887 only to find that a new policy has been implemented that prevents this. We are therefore requesting this as a bundled plugin.

 

 

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 Jul 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with Confluence. We agree that this functionality will be very useful for our customers.

As of now, it is not on the Confluence Cloud's roadmap. Please remember that [jira.atlassian.com|http://jira.atlassian.com/] is one of many inputs for the Confluence roadmap. I have created and linked a corresponding suggestion in Confluence Cloud team's Jira project for better tracking: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-67229. We will update the issue as we make further progress on it.

 

Shrey,

Product Manager, Confluence Cloud team

{panel}
fields.summary: Request for Sharepoint plugin to be bundled with Confluence Cloud
Creating sub-task from review comment provides misleading response
Unable to add project when there is no existing projects

fields.description:
An entry in the history drop-down menu displays a JIRA issue of which the summary line is in Chinese. The first 3 Chinese characters display correctly but the 4th character is corrupted. It looks like the 4th character was cut through the middle somehow, leaving a corrupted symbol. This happens to all menu entries with Chinese characters in it, and it seems always happen at the 4th character.

!history_i18n.png!

If we click the problematic menu item, it still correctly brings up the target page, on which the Chinese characters are all shown well.

Checking the DOM indicates something like this:

!history_i18n_2.png!
fields.summary: i18n issue in history menu

fields.description:
JIRA 4.3 and 4.4 are targeted at 1.6_u25. 4.4 won't run under our current version (u17).
FE/Cru has no known issues at u25 but has not been tested. There is a problem with running functional tests on u18, which we have a chance of seeing, so we need to watch out for that.
Crowd has no known issues but has not been tested.
Confluence has no known issues. Customers run it. It has not been tested.
I'm yet to talk to Bamboo - both teams have gone missing in their entirety :/ I blame the pyramid aliens.

This job will involve Contegix interaction and possibly unicorn interaction. That is why I've given it task points 8 - it's not going to be quick.
This task blocks upgrading JIRA to 4.4.
fields.summary: Upgrade to JVM 1.6_u26

fields.summary: Reassess the permgen size for each application

fields.description:
According to Studio documentation (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Creating+Links), linking to Bamboo build plans and build results is supported. Limited tests show that this does not seem to work.

- In a Wiki page which resides in the project's Space, 
-- a valid build plan key in wiki markup doesn't render as a link to the build plan. The build plan key is displayed as plain text.
-- a valid build result key in wiki markup renders as a hyper link, but the link isn't rendered from the whole string but only from the later half of it, and the link is not a valid link to the build result page. For example, a valid build result key {{DRA-PKG-5}} was inserted, but only the "{{PKG-5}}" part rendered to an invalid hyper link, which was {{https://googledev.jira.com/browse/PKG-5}}

- In a JIRA issue's comment, neither the build plan key nor the build result key render as hyper links. Both of them are displayed as plain text.

Tim suggested that the link to a build _plan_ doesn't seem to have been implemented. Only the implementation of build _result_ link was found.
fields.summary: Linking to Bamboo build plan and build result not working

fields.description:
When the studio icon is set to a custom URL, when you return to the page, the URL is not repopulated into the form. If the form is submitted with a blank URL, it throws a 500 error.

Even if it handles the error more nicely, they should not be required to re-enter the URL every time when editing unrelated settings.

Repro steps:
1) Administration->General->Look and Feel->Edit Configuration
2) Pick "URL" for the icon and paste your favourite image URL in. Click "Update".
Now, it's three weeks later, you've forgotten where the icon came from, and you just want to change the header colour. 
3) Click "Edit Configuration".
4) Leave the icon settings unchanged. Pick a new header colour and click "Update".

A 500 error is thrown because it tries to parse the empty icon URL.

fields.description:
GApps builds are failing with HTTP 500s coming back from crowd/plugins/servlet/upgrade, e.g. https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-JST-GAPPSIMPLE-283.

fields.description:
Our [Data Backups|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Data+Backups] policy is not clear about the situation when a customer accidentally removes JIRA/Confluence data - and it has happened a few times.

Please refer the question we created at answers: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/233/i-accidentally-deleted-several-project-on-my-jira-studio-instance-can-you-recover-that

Currently, we would be able to recover JIRA and Confluence data by using database backup (that one automatically created every 12 hours). We'd not be able to recover deleted attachments though.

It would be good to have an ETA for that.
The technical procedure would be https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Recover+JIRA+or+Confluence+Database+Using+Daily+Backups
fields.summary: Data Backups policy review

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# Log in to JIRA Studio
# Create a sample issue in Testing project (such as: https://example.jira.com/browse/TST-1)
# Go to Administration -> Issues -> Global Settings -> Trackbacks and make sure that 'Accept Incoming Trackback Pings' is being set to ON
# Go to Administration -> Wiki -> Configuration -> General Configuration and click 'Edit'
# Check on 'Trackback' option and submit
# Create a sample page in a testing space
# Use the full URL of the issue (https://example.jira.com/browse/TST-1) and paste it to the new Confluence page. Save
# Go back to JIRA issue page and click on Refresh
# No trackback appears on this page

This is caused by [JRA-24628|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24628].

fields.description:
This happens after upgrading Studio from the May release (Bamboo 2.6.5) to the current trunk (Bamboo 3.0.4). Before the upgrade, some builds were associated with certain JIRA issues, and on the result page of these builds, the JIRA issue key along with its summary line were displayed correctly. After the upgrade, on the same result page, those JIRA issues were still associated with the builds; however, only the issue key was displayed. The issue summary line was not shown. At its place, a text string of "_Could not obtain issue details from JIRA_" was displayed instead.

The problem only exists with those builds that were executed _prior to_ the upgrade; for those builds that were executed after the upgrade, both the associated JIRA issue key and its summary line were displayed correctly.
!issue_summary.png!

fields.description:
This happens to the May release with Bamboo 2.6.5. The build notification email displays Chinese characters as question marks. These characters come from the following sources:

fields.description:
FishEye in Studio, by default, has an Xmx of 512MB of RAM, however it's not uncommon to see its {{java}} process using upwards of 2GB of resident RAM.

This can happen even on instances with a negligible SVN repo and next to no usage.

We need to fix this problem because it pushes the other apps out to swap, resulting in degraded performance.
fields.summary: FishEye sometimes uses extremely large amounts of memory

From [~tcampbell]:

{noformat}
At the moment we have set up to turn the links off for Studio my using a system property, we don't really like this very much but it was the only way while we waited for SAL 2.6.x  Now we have SAL and so can change it to using an application property.

To use the application property you (Studio) will need to add a bit of xml to jpm.xml
        <property>
            <key>jira.show.contact.administrators.form</key>
            <default-value>false</default-value>
            <type>boolean</type>
            <user-editable>true</user-editable>
        </property>

We are happy to go with which ever mechanism is easier/preferred by you guys.
{noformat}

fields.description: Since SVN data is changing from underneath FishEye, all its repos should be re-indexed. Otherwise it's possible that the FishEye scanner will get confused. fields.description:
After upgrading Studio on {{googledev.jira.com}} from the May release (Bamboo version 2.6.5) to the current trunk (Bamboo version 3.0.4) via the "Upgrade Deployment" option provide by AAM, the "Last Successful Build" time on some pages seems to be wrong. It looks like somehow Bamboo confused _the time when it was *upgraded* to the new version_ with _the time when the build actually happened_, (which in this case was in its previous incarnation, i.e. before the upgraded had happened).

For example, in the following page, Bamboo said the build was successful since #1 which was built 18 minutes ago, but that was not true. The last successful build actually happened 17 hours ago when Bamboo had not been upgraded yet. The point in time of "18 minutes ago" was when Bamboo was upgraded, not when the build was run.

And another problem is that the "18 minutes" seems never change - it was still 18 minutes when I refreshed the page 1 hour later.

!wrong_history.png!
fields.summary: Bamboo 3.0: incorrect build history after upgrade from 2.6.5

fields.description:
After upgrading Studio on {{googledev.jira.com}} from the May release (Bamboo version 2.6.5) to the current trunk (Bamboo version 3.0.4) via the "Upgrade Deployment" option provide by AAM, it looks like there are some "fake" build comments generated based on the existing comments created prior to the upgrade. For example, 15 hours ago, I made a built comment "Blah blah blah" in the old version, then about 30 minutes ago I upgraded Studio. After the upgrade completed successfully, I saw 2 comments with exactly the same content of "Blah blah blah" in the new version of Bamboo, one bearing the correct time-stamp which is the time when it was originally created, while the other one bearing a wrong time-stamp which was actually the time when the upgrade actually happened.
!build_comment.png!
fields.summary: Bamboo 3.0: "fake" build comments generated after upgrade from 2.6.5

fields.description:
When importing JIRA data into Studio on Unicorn, if the import takes longer than a few minutes, the user is redirected to the "Website is Down" screen and cannot complete the process.

In this case, the import took slightly longer because it contained Applinks to external servers that it attempted to contact, but it could have just as easily been a large data set. 

After the import had been running for several minutes, the browser was automatically redirected to the "Website is Down" screen with the electrocuting Charlie picture. From this point there is no way to succesfully complete the rest of the import steps - reloading the page attempts to returned to the previous step of the wizard, which then tells the user off for pressing "Back" and tells them to start again.

!LongRunningImport.png!
fields.summary: Longer-running Studio imports get the "Website is down" notification screen and can't be completed on Unicorn

fields.description:
When Google is down, attempting to log in gives the following error: "Could not connect to the IdP to verify identities".

!GoogleError.png!

This message is unclear and it essentially encourages the user to raise a Support request, when we can't do anything about it. It would be better to recraft the error message to indicate that Google is most likely down.
fields.summary: Unhelpful error message is shown on login when Google is down

fields.description:
I tried to release Studio 104 yesterday. I ran {{mvn release:prepare}} and it made a branch using {{svn copy}}. A problem was that it used a bad SCM path in pom.xml, which came from an old branch merge.

trunk's pom.xml had:

{code}
<scm>
    <connection>scm:svn:https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/JST/branches/studio-streams4-upgrade</connection>
    <developerConnection>scm:svn:https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/JST/branches/studio-streams4-upgrade</developerConnection>
    <url>https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/JST/branches/studio-streams4-upgrade</url>
</scm>
{code}

Notice that it's pointing to studio-streams4-upgrade (from a prior merge). It should have been:

{code}
<scm>
    <connection>scm:svn:https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/JST/trunk</connection>
    <developerConnection>scm:svn:https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/JST/trunk</developerConnection>
    <url>https://studio.atlassian.com/svn/JST/trunk</url>
</scm>
{code}

We should create some type of check for this. Ashwin pointed out that [JST-DEPS|https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/JST-DEPS] already does some validation for trunk and we should be able to extend it to the <scm> element.

It took a lot of time to track down this problem and to fix it. I had to rollback the changes, put code freeze back in place, fix up the SCM path and do the release again. Felipe, Sam H and Alex all mentioned that this problem has happened before. Putting this check in place might make releases smoother.
fields.summary: Add check for <scm> paths in pom.xml

But after some refreshes, the page comes back to normal.

Browser configuration, proxy and intranet configuration were already investigated on the following issue:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-19575

We didn't find a root cause of this, but investigated the following points:

* Gives the error with Firefox and Chrome
* The error started after the last Jira Studio Release
* The user didn't use any kind of "Privacy Mode" on his browser

Best Regards
Nícolas Wildner- Support Engineer
fields.summary: Idle session on Gapps causes BackTrace. After some refreshes, it come back to normal

fields.description:
In the SVN Commit Hooks configuration page (http://domain.jira.com/secure/admin/SvnCommitHooks.jspa), the explanation of the pre-commit hook is as this:

bq. Here you can manage commit hooks for SVN. The only functionality currently available is to enforce the inclusion of #open or a JIRA ticket number in a commit.

In reality, we do not support the #open tag in commit message at all. Possibly, it is meant to be something along the line "... to enforce the inclusion of an open JIRA ticket number in a commit." (no closed JIRA issues).

Check out our documentation, which is more accurate, but can be misleading too - http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Configure+Commits+to+Require+a+JIRA+Issue+Key
fields.summary: Possible rewording of SVN Commit Hooks page

fields.description:
Having a Jabber Integration would be awesome.

- Add jabber credentials in the general settings.
- Add jabber name in every user profile.
- Add function in Notification Schemes.

Offer possibility to push Activity Stream to a Jabber Group Channel.
fields.summary: Integrate Jabber Notification

fields.description: This class currently restores the "Remote Crowd Directory" from the application before import and checks and restores it after import. The CrowdNestedGroupDisabler disables the internal directory and disables nested group support for all other directories. These two classes can be consolidated and the new class should check the current configuration based on a template created from the InitialDataService.
fields.summary: RemoteCrowdDirectoryRestorer should always restore the "Remote Crowd Directory"

fields.description:
As of JIRA 4.4 there are dialogs in admin section that rely on decorator=inline parameter so that they don't get admin headers etc. appended. This parameter, when different than admin, is not respected by Studio, which causes the dialogs to have studio admin headers appended. 

Additionally, the workflow designer has some special code to remove chrome from JIRA admin pages when it pops up some pages e.g. viewing transitions. The same fix is needed here to enable the fixes on JWD side to work in Studio. [~andreask] will handle the changes required on the workflow designer plugin side.
fields.summary: Make admin decorator mapper respect decorator parameters in request or page

fields.description:
In IE7, when browsing the source code in FishEye, if we click any node of the source code directory tree-view, such as the "trunk" tree node, there will be 2 strange observations:
# the menu text on the navigation bar will all squeeze together, and at the same time the gap between adjacent header tabs disappeared.
# the resizable pane displaying the source code will constantly change its size. Please see this screen video: https://confxhtml.atlassian.com/download/attachments/55247116/funky-1.swf?version=1&modificationDate=1304558721691

(The first problem only happens with the new header, while the second problem happens with the old version as well so doesn't seem to be new header related - but they are both triggered by the same operation; therefore, I put them into the same issue.)

!FishEye-menu.png!
fields.summary: Header: FishEye navigation bar menus squeezed together after certain operations in IE7
